CRUK-CI Genologics API Client 2.27.4 API

This project is the Cambridge Research UK Cambridge Institute (CRUK-CI) Java client for Genologics' REST API.

See: Description

org.cruk.genologics.api
The main public package of the Genologics API.
org.cruk.genologics.api.cache
Package supporting caching of Genologics entities in memory (or, if so configured, on disk) to reduce the amount of traffic being sent to and from the Genologics REST API.
org.cruk.genologics.api.debugging
Aspects and beans to aid with tracking the exchanges with the Genologics API for debugging purposes.
org.cruk.genologics.api.http
Classes specific to the REST template operation.
org.cruk.genologics.api.impl
Concrete implementation classes of the Genologics API.
org.cruk.genologics.api.jaxb
Classes to aid the JAXB object mapping process.

This project is the Cambridge Research UK Cambridge Institute (CRUK-CI) Java client for Genologics' REST API.

It wraps a REST client to allow Java objects to be used for working with the Clarity system. The object to XML translations are handled automatically, as are the HTTP exchanges. It requires the Spring framework and uses many of its features.

The model classes were originally generated from Genologics' XSD schema documents. They are embellished with interfaces to distinguish between the actual entities and the links to those entities. The classes as presented here should allow users of this client to work with the Clarity API with minimal overhead.

The XSD files are packaged with this project: all rights to these belong to Genologics.

To use the client, create a Spring application context including the file org/cruk/genologics/api/genologics-client-context.xml, from which you can obtain the bean "genologicsAPI". If you wish to use the caching facility, also add the file org/cruk/genologics/api/genologics-cache-context.xml to the application context path.

Author:
Richard Bowers (richard.bowers@cruk.cam.ac.uk)
See Also:
Genologics Developer Documentation, The Spring Framework, Java Architecture for XML Binding (JAXB), Apache HTTP Components, Ehcache
